intro: Hieracium intonsum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium intonsum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
